page.title: 03EASTHAM MEMORIAL HALL
page.content: A MOTHER AND TODDLER GROUP MEETS HERE EVERY WEDNESDAY FOR 1\ HRS. THE MOTHERS LOOK AFTER THEIR OWN CHILDREN AND TAKE TURNS AT OPENING UP THE HALL AND BEING IN CHARGE. THE MOTHERS EACH BRING A TOY FOR THE CHILDREN TO RIDE ON. THEY COME FROM NEWNHAM, ROCHFORD,TENBURY AND EASTHAM. EACH MOTHER PAYS 5OP A WEEK. THE ORGANISERS PAY Â£3.OO FOR THE HALL. THE CHILDREN GET SQUASH AND A BISCUIT AND THE MOTHERS GET COFFEE. WE SAW THE TODDLERS RIDING TRICYCLES AND PLAYING WITH TEDDIES,TRACTORS AND A TELEPHONE. WE TALKED TO MRS CULLEN WHO WAS IN CHARGE THAT DAY. SHE SAID THE GROUP STARTED IN JANUARY 1985.
